Ansible Roadmap: A Complete Guide [2025 Updated]

Master Ansible in 2025 with this roadmap covering automation fundamentals, playbooks, inventories, modules, roles, and enterprise practices.

What is Ansible?

Ansible is an agentless automation tool by Redâ€¯Hat that uses SSH to configure systems, deploy apps, and orchestrate workflows via YAML playbooks.

Why Ansible?

It enables reproducible infrastructure management, clear human-readable syntax, wide module support, and easy integration with CI/CD.

1. Installation & Setup

Install via pip or apt/yum (`pip install ansible`), verify with `ansible --version` and configure `ansible.cfg`.

2. Inventories & Hosts

Define static (INI/YAML) or dynamic inventories. Test connectivity: `ansible all -m ping -i inventory`.

3. Simple Ad-hoc Commands

Run quick tasks like `ansible all -m yum -a "name=nginx state=present"`.

4. Playbooks & Tasks

Write YAML playbooks with `hosts`, `tasks`, `handlers`, `tags` and module usage.

5. Variables & Facts

Use group_vars, host_vars, facts (`ansible_facts`), `set_fact`, defaults, and precedence.

6. Modules & Plugins

Utilize built-in modules (`yum`, `template`, `uri`) and plugins (lookup, filter).

7. Roles & File Structure

Organize reusable logic under `roles/` with standard subfolders.

8. Handlers & Notify

Use `handlers` to run actions conditionally, triggered via `notify`.

9. Conditionals & Loops

Use `when`, `with_items`, `loop`, filters, and Jinja templating.

10. Templates with Jinja2

Use `.j2` templates for dynamic configurations with variables and expressions.

11. Error Handling & Idempotence

Enable `--check`, `--diff`, use `failed_when`, ensure safe retries.

12. Vault & Encryption

Secure secrets with `ansible-vault`, use encrypted variables and files.

13. Dynamic Inventories

Integrate with AWS, Azure, GCP, Kubernetes for auto hosts discovery.

14. Ansible Galaxy & Collections

Use community roles with `ansible-galaxy`, create or publish Collections.

15. Testing & Linting

Integrate `ansible-lint`, `yamllint`, and test with Molecule.

16. CI/CD Integration

Plug into pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) and run playbooks as steps.

17. Automation & Orchestration

Use `ansible-pull`, orchestrate via Tower/AWX UI.

18. Performance Tuning

Optimize control-machine, use pipelining, forks, delegate, throttle.

19. Enterprise & Tower

Use Ansible Tower/AWX for RBAC, job scheduling, and credential management.

20. Best Practices

- Keep roles small & focused - Use vault for secrets - Use CI & testing - Follow idempotence strictly
